conclusion: The problem involves predicting which container (E, F, or G) liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from points A, B, C, and D.
The image shows four liquid entry points labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, with baffles of various colors and orientations below them, leading to three containers labeled E, F, and G at the bottom.
Point A is located above a brown baffle slanting downwards to the right.
Point B is located above a pink baffle slanting downwards to the left.
Point C is located above a yellow baffle slanting downwards to the right.
Point D is located above a blue baffle slanting downwards to the left.
The bottom of the image shows three containers: E (brown), F (pink), and G (blue), each aligned with the baffles above.
Liquid from point A will flow along the brown baffle and reach container E.
Liquid from point B will flow along the pink baffle and reach container F.
Liquid from point C will flow along the yellow baffle and reach container G.
Liquid from point D will flow along the blue baffle and reach container G.
